title: Programming Skill Development Course Through Educational Robotics

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Conducts STEM-integrated learning in smartphone-based constrained technical environments, measuring outcomes through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Learners write programs solving 3+ real-world problems (e.g., automatic door control, traffic light systems) using conditional statements (if-else, switch-case) and loop structures (for, while) in a robot control programming environment, achieving 80%+ functional completeness via peer evaluation and teacher verification.
Learners can experience algorithm design and debugging processes for real-world problem-solving
Learners develop practical programming application skills by solving mathematical problems through ER (Error Reduction) methods
Creative problem-solving skills are enhanced through STEM-integrated tasks

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
